location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 7 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Secret Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting that Shaikh Humood ben Mahomed has stated that the purpose of Ali ben Ibraheem ul Mureykhee's visit to Egypt is solely for soliciting the aid of Abass Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt [Wāli of Egypt and Sudan], for the rulers of Bahrain. It explains that it is hoped that the Pasha will be able to separate Ameer Fysul [Amīr Fayṣul], Chief of the Wahabee [Wahhabi], from the cause of their kinsmen at Demaun [Ad-Dammān]. It also notes that he has apologised for the omission in consulting with the Resident beforehand.
